results.title: Motion and balance
results.creator_credit: Tarquin Cardona, Bob Starner, Olga Palacio, First Light Pictures and Schlessinger Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physical science in action”.
Nothing in the universe is at rest. With the Earth spinning and moving through space, everything is actually in motion. The only way we can tell that things are in motion is to compare them to other things nearby. This is called relative motion. This program presents a clear explanation of Newton’s Law of Motion, including the concepts of inertia, acceleration, velocity, equilibrium and momentum. Students are taken on a fun trip to a bowling alley and a golf course for real-life examples to explain these concepts. Also explored is the key idea of net force and how it relates to motion and balance. Suitable for Upper primary/Lower secondary students. Teachers notes included.

results.title: Motion
results.creator_credit: Murray Louis and Jack Lieb Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dance as an art form”
Part of a series designed to introduce dance as an art form. Illustrates how commonplace actions can be sensed and then transformed through selection, arrangement and skillful performance. Narrated by Murray Louis.

results.title: Mothers are people
results.brief_description: Joy is a research biologist, a consultant to a large company. She is also a widow with two school-age children. In discussing her own dilemmas she speaks for many other women. “The powers that be know that women do work, but they turn a deaf ear.” Apart from “discrimination against women,” Joy sees the absence of universal day care as a loss for children too.

results.title: Mother tongue. No. 3. Reading and writing
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Eileen Molony and George Inger
results.brief_description: Part of a series providing an insight into the stages by which young children from birth to 11 years old learn to use, understand, read and write their own language. Deals mainly with the introduction of writing as part of general language development.

results.title: Mother of many children
results.creator_credit: Alanis Obomsawin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film is an album of Native womanhood, portraying a proud egalitarian matriarchal society that for centuries has been pressured to adopt different standards and customs. All of the women featured share a belief in the importance of tradition as a source of strength in the face of change. Ethnographic documentation of Native Canadian ‘American’ post colonialisation which includes documented accounts of the ‘stolen generation’ in Native American tribes and personal accounts of racial discrimination. Directed, written, produced and narrated by Alanis Obomsawin. (Awards: San Francisco; Dieppe)

results.title: Mother of kings = Sons and comrades = Matka krolow
results.creator_credit: Zespol Filmowy X, Rondo, Film Polski and Janusz Zaorski
results.brief_description: Sons and comrades is a powerful political drama based on the novel by Kazimierz Brandys with screenplay and direction by Janusz Zaorski. Spanning the period 1933-1956, it tells the story of Lucja Krol (Magda Teresa Wojcik), an unemployed widow with four sons, and her struggle to survive almost twenty-five years of economic depression, poverty, occupation of Poland by the Nazis, persecution and political oppression. To Lucja, holding the family together was paramount. For her sons, it was the fight for an independent Poland, free of Nazi Germany control, and a total commitment to the Communist Party. However, at the end of the war with a new regime in Poland, another form of persecution began to take place. Instead of freedom and peace, the 1950s became a time of fear, when friend betrayed friend and former heroes of the independence struggle were jailed as traitors - a time of expedient political trials, torture and even death. It is during this time that Klemens (Boguslaw Linda) Lucja’s son, is inexplicably arrested and accused of being a collaborator. His eventual fate is never revealed to Lucja. A stark film of harsh reality portraying a time of political upheaval and uncertainty in Poland. “Mother of kings” was shelved for five years until 1987 when censorship restrictions became more relaxed in communist Poland. It is an outstanding film with superb direction by Janusz Zaorski and an excellent cast including Zbigniew Zapasiewicz, Franciszek Pieczka, Michal Juszczakiewicz, Adam Ferency. (Awards: Poland 1987; Berlin 1988)

results.title: Mother night
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Keith Gordon and Robert B Weide
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Kurt Vonnegut “Mother Night” follows the story of an American playwright (Nick Nolte) living in Germany during WWII. He is approached by a US agent to become a spy. By broadcasting coded Nazi propaganda on the radio he is able to pass on allied information. During this time he seems to be a convincing Nazi. With only a few knowing his true beliefs he finds himself helpless in Israel on trial for war crimes. A moody story of assumed identity and a man alone in a strange world. Cast includes Alan Arkin, Kristen Dunst, John Goodman and an appearance of Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

results.title: Mother may I?
results.creator_credit: Shared Futures Films, Gina Blumenfeld and Linda Feferman
results.brief_description: SEX EDUCATION - Treats aspects of teeage sexuality in a narrative context. A sixteen-year-old girl fears that she may be pregnant but is reluctant to confide in her parents. Depicts her reactions to her predicament, as well as those of her boyfriend and eleven-year-old sister who share her anxiety. Raises issues surrounding pregnancy, adoption, abortion, and family relationships. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
